questions.question: Why is everything still?

questions.question: Why is the night called silver? (Variant 51)
questions.answer: Because moonlight coats the world in silver.

questions.question: How does moonlight change ordinary objects? (Variant 52)
questions.answer: It paints roofs, trees and fields in a glowing colour.

questions.question: Why is everything so quiet? (Variant 53)
questions.answer: Animals rest and nature sleeps.

questions.question: Which animals appear in the poem? (Variant 54)
questions.answer: Dog, doves and a mouse.

questions.question: What is the dog doing in the yard? (Variant 55)
questions.answer: It sleeps in its kennel.

questions.question: Why is the mouse cautious? (Variant 56)
questions.answer: It fears predators in the still night.

questions.question: How does the poet make the scene magical? (Variant 57)
questions.answer: Through images of shine, stillness and soft motion.

questions.question: Why is the poem peaceful? (Variant 58)
questions.answer: Calm night and gentle movement soothe the mind.

questions.question: What emotion does moonlight inspire? (Variant 59)
questions.answer: Wonder and quiet appreciation of nature.

questions.question: Why is the title suitable? (Variant 60)
questions.answer: All objects seem dipped in silver.

questions.question: Describe how moonlight transforms the night world in the poem. (Insight 151)
questions.answer: Moonlight covers roofs, branches and living creatures, changing their colour into silver.

questions.question: Explain how movement and stillness work together in the imagery. (Insight 152)
questions.answer: Animals barely stir while shadows shift slightly, creating balance between rest and life.

questions.question: How does the poet use sound and silence to build atmosphere? (Insight 153)
questions.answer: Silence dominates, but tiny movements create a dreamy visual rhythm.

questions.question: Why is the poem a celebration of nature’s beauty? (Insight 154)
questions.answer: It highlights quiet beauty that appears only when we slow down and look.

questions.question: What message about observation can readers learn? (Insight 155)
questions.answer: Looking carefully at ordinary scenes reveals hidden magic.
